title: Tuple vs List Mutability
creator: Dan McCreary
subject: Computer Science
description: Interactive p5.js MicroSim comparing mutable lists with immutable tuples using identical operations and immediate visual feedback.

learningObjectives: Explain the difference between mutable lists and immutable tuples by comparing outcomes of change, add, and remove operations.
Identify why tuple modification attempts raise runtime errors while list modifications succeed.

pedagogical.teachingStrategy: Direct side-by-side comparison with immediate success/error feedback
keyQuestions: Why does changing an item succeed for a list but fail for a tuple?
What does immutable mean in practical coding terms?
commonMisconceptions: Tuples and lists are interchangeable for all operations
Parentheses vs brackets is only stylistic
assessmentOpportunities: Students explain observed behavior after each operation
Students classify new operations as valid for list, tuple, or both
